summary: This is an email chain from August 5, 2020, regarding the transmission of a large set of PDF documents (SDNY_GM_00000834 through SDNY_GM_00000962) within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY). The email discusses logistical issues with file size and thanks a contractor for a quick fix.

persons.name: Special Assistant to the U.S. Attorney
persons.role: Special Assistant to the U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The recipient of the forwarded email, identified by their title within the United States Attorney's Office, SDNY.

events.title: Document Transmission Coordination
events.description: Email exchange coordinating the sending of a large batch of PDF documents (SDNY_GM_00000834 to SDNY_GM_00000962) within the U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, due to large file size.

locations: United States Attorney's Office, SDNY (Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: The document is an email dated August 5, 2020, concerning the transmission of a large set of files within the SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office.
The files referenced are a sequence of PDFs from SDNY_GM_00000834 to SDNY_GM_00000962, which are likely internal case documents.
The communication highlights logistical coordination (file zipping/splitting) due to the large total file size.
The email thanks a contractor for a 'quick fix', indicating technical or procedural support was provided.
The correspondence is internal to the prosecuting office handling the Epstein case, showing document management activity.
